data.title: ‘Star Wars’ Seeking Galactic Signing: Sigourney Weaver in Talks to Join ‘The Mandalorian & Grogu’ Movie
data.meta_description: Sigourney Weaver is in advanced talks to join the cast of 'Star Wars' movie 'The Mandalorian & Grogu'.
data.text:
The ‘Star Wars’ franchise continues to expand with new productions in both film and television. And among the most anticipated projects is ‘The Mandalorian & Grogu’, a film directed by Jon Favreau that promises to be a turning point in the so-called ‘Mandoverse’. However, this movie may have an ace up its sleeve, as the famous actress Sigourney Weaver, star of the ‘Alien’ franchise, is in advanced talks to join the cast, according to The Hollywood Reporter.

A sci-fi icon on her way to ‘Star Wars’

It is currently unknown what role Sigourney Weaver will be playing, but it is expected to be a prominent one, as signing a star of this caliber is not usually for a simple cameo. Filming on ‘The Mandalorian & Grogu’ is expected to begin in late 2024 with Kathleen Kennedy and Dave Filoni, two prominent figures in the present of the Lucasfilm franchise, as producers; Weaver would join Pedro Pascal in his usual role of Din Djarin, although the Chilean actor is not under the Mandalorian’s helmet in many of his scenes.
